com.bigdata.rdf.sail.webapp.lbs

Interface IHALoadBalancerPolicy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IHAPolicyLifeCycle
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractHostLBSPolicy, AbstractLBSPolicy, CountersLBSPolicy, GangliaLBSPolicy, NOPLBSPolicy, RoundRobinLBSPolicy

    public interface IHALoadBalancerPolicy
extends IHAPolicyLifeCycle
    Load balancer policy interface.
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson
    See Also:
    HALoadBalancerServlet, HA Load Balancer

    • Method Detail

      • service

        boolean service(boolean isLeaderRequest,
              HALoadBalancerServlet servlet,
              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                       IOException
        Invoked for each request. If the response is not committed, then it will be handled by the HALoadBalancerServlet.
        Parameters:
        isLeaderRequest - true iff this request must be directed to the leaeder and false iff this request may be load balanced over the joined services. UPDATEs MUST be handled by the leader. Read requests can be handled by any service that is joined with the met quorum.
        servlet - The HALoadBalancerServlet. This is exposed in order to allow the IHALoadBalancerPolicy to perform a local forward of the request.
        request - The request.
        response - The response.
        Returns:
        true iff the request was handled.
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        IOException

      • getLeaderURI

        String getLeaderURI(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        Return the Request-URI to which a non-idempotent request will be proxied.
        Parameters:
        req - The request.
        Returns:
        The proxyTo Request-URI -or- null if we could not find a service to which we could proxy this request.

      • getReaderURI

        String getReaderURI(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        Return the Request-URL to which a read-only request will be proxied. The returned URL must include the protocol, hostname and port (if a non-default port will be used) as well as the target request path.
        Parameters:
        req - The request.
        Returns:
        The proxyTo Request-URI -or- null if we could not find a service to which we could proxy this request.
